documentId: Understanding Arguments_ An Introduction to Informal Logic (1)
content:
inem arguments because they start
from premises about the person’s character or status. Where they differ is in
their conclusions: Deniers conclude that a claim is untrue or that an argu-
ment is unsound or weak. Silencers conclude that someone lacks the right to
speak in a certain context. Dismissers conclude that someone is untrustwor-
thy or unreliable. Each can be either justified or unjustified, so there are six
kinds that can be diagrammed like this:
Ad Hominem ArgumentsJustifiedNot Justif
